column4: The VirtualBox kernel driver is not accessible to the current user. Make sure that the user has write permissions for /dev/vboxdrv by adding them to the vboxusers groups. You will need to logout for the change to take effect..,
hello
how can i correct this ? :(

The VirtualBox kernel driver is not accessible to the current user. Make sure that the user has write permissions for /dev/vboxdrv by adding them to the vboxusers groups. You will need to logout for the change to take effect..
If you paid attention during the installation of VirtualBox, it tells you all about that and how to set it up.
how can i correct it?
You need to add yourself to the VBox group.
how :( ?
System -> Administration -> Users and Groups
Then click the "Manage Groups" button.  Find "vboxusers" in the list, click it.  Then click the "Properties" button.  Put a checkmark by your username.
i did it
Did you skip the part of your error message that said you had to log out for the changes to take effect?
what will i do now ? won't you help me ?
I told you what to do.
i did
You logged out?
bo bootable medium found :(
I can't help you if you refuse to read what VirtualBox tries to tell you, bud.  Sorry
can you look this please http://img443.imageshack.us/img443/2033/screenshotpz1.png
Yeah... you haven't installed an operating system for that virtual machine.
what can i do at this time ?
Mount the Windows XP cd and start it again.
i see, thank you.
